intro: Eulophia formosana, commonly known as the Formosan eulophia, is a flowering plant native to Taiwan. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, often brightly colored flowers. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid forest environments. Its leaves are usually broad and革质 (leathery), aiding in water retention. The flowers are borne on inflorescences and are known for their intricate structure and ornamental value.
